text: Ekushey Padak () is one of the highest civilian awards in Bangladesh. It was introduced in memory of the martyrs of the Language Movement of 1952 ().Om Gupta, Encyclopaedia of India, Pakistan and Bangladesh (Delhi: Isha Books, 2006), p. 691 The award consists of 100,000 Taka, an 18 carat gold medal weighing 3 tolas. It also includes a certificate of honour. The medal was designed by the artist Nitun Kundu.Obituary of Nitun Kundu, The Daily Star, September 16, 2006. The amount of the cash reward was originally 25 thousand taka, but it was increased to 100 thousand taka. The Ministry of Cultural Affairs manages the Padak. ==Prize categories and winners== * Ekushey Padak in Language movement * Ekushey Padak in Language and literature * Ekushey Padak in Education and research * Ekushey Padak in Arts * Ekushey Padak in Journalism * Ekushey Padak in Science and technology * Ekushey Padak in Social welfare ==Awards by decade== * Ekushey Padak Awards (1976–1979) * Ekushey Padak Awards (1980–1989) * Ekushey Padak Awards (1990–1999) * Ekushey Padak Awards (2000–2009) * Ekushey Padak Awards (2010–2019) ==References== Category:1976 establishments in Asia Category:1970s establishments in Bangladesh
